skill.name: docs-retrieval
skill.description: Retrieve documentation context from local ai-docs. Check here first when implementing features, debugging errors, or needing library information. Fall back to web search if topic not found locally.
skill.summary: Retrieve documentation context from local ai-docs. Check here first when implementing features, debu...
skill.author: Consiliency

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code, network calls, file system access, or external commands. It only contains markdown files with instructions for retrieving documentation using the @ai-docs protocol.

content.value_statement: Stop wasting tokens on web searches when local documentation has the answers. This skill helps you navigate and load specific documentation sections before falling back to web searches.
actual_capabilities: Navigate hierarchical ai-docs structure using @ai-docs protocol
Load specific page summaries instead of full documentation
Consolidate context from multiple libraries efficiently
Follow token budget guidelines to optimize context usage
Pre-load context for sub-agents before spawning
limitations: Requires existing ai-docs structure with @ai-docs protocol
Cannot create new documentation - only retrieves existing content
Dependent on proper TOON file formatting in documentation system
Token estimates assume standard documentation sizes

use_cases.title: Feature Implementation Guidance
use_cases.description: Load relevant documentation for libraries before coding to understand APIs, patterns, and gotchas

use_cases.title: Error Debugging Support
use_cases.description: Quickly find error handling and troubleshooting documentation for specific libraries

use_cases.title: Sub-Agent Context Preparation
use_cases.description: Pre-load documentation context before spawning sub-agents to avoid redundant navigation

prompt_templates.title: Direct Library Navigation
prompt_templates.scenario: You know exactly which library and topic you need
prompt_templates.prompt: Use direct navigation to load @ai-docs/libraries/{library}/_index.toon, find the relevant section, then load the specific page summary

prompt_templates.title: Keyword Search Discovery
prompt_templates.scenario: You're unsure which library covers your topic
prompt_templates.prompt: Start with @ai-docs/libraries/_index.toon, scan library descriptions for keywords matching your need, then explore promising libraries

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Library Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: List all involved libraries, load their indexes and relevant pages, then consolidate into a single context block

prompt_templates.title: Full Context Deep Dive
prompt_templates.scenario: You need comprehensive understanding for major decisions
prompt_templates.prompt: Only use @ai-docs/libraries/{library}/full-context.md for migrations, tutorials, or architectural decisions - it's 5,000-15,000 tokens

output_examples.input: I need to implement retry logic with BAML
output: Found: common_tasks â†’ 'Handle errors gracefully' â†’ guide/error-handling
Key points: RetryPolicy syntax, timeout gotchas, backoff strategies
Gotcha: Timeouts include network latency, not just processing time

best_practices: Always check local ai-docs before web searches - it's faster and optimized for LLMs
Use targeted page loading instead of full-context.md to save tokens
Pre-load context for sub-agents to avoid redundant navigation
Follow the consolidation format when gathering from multiple sources
anti_patterns: Don't load full-context.md for simple questions - use specific pages instead
Don't skip documentation and rely on memory - take 30 seconds to load relevant pages
Don't let each sub-agent navigate from scratch - pass pre-loaded context
Don't load all libraries 'just in case' - be specific about what you need

faq.question: Is this compatible with all Claude Code versions?
faq.answer: Yes, it uses the standard @ai-docs protocol available in all Claude Code environments with ai-docs installed

faq.question: What if the documentation I need isn't in ai-docs?
faq.answer: The skill will guide you to fall back to web search after confirming the topic isn't available locally

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing documentation?
faq.answer: Yes, if you convert your documentation to the TOON format and place it in the ai-docs structure

faq.question: How does this ensure data safety?
faq.answer: The skill only reads local documentation files and doesn't execute code or make network calls

faq.question: What if I accidentally load too much context?
faq.answer: The context is already consumed, but you can note which sections were useful for more targeted loading next time

faq.question: How is this better than regular web searches?
faq.answer: Local docs are faster, pre-curated for LLMs, include gotchas, and use tokens more efficiently than full web pages
